Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கருமணியிற் பாவாய்நீ போதாயாம் வீழும்திருநுதற்கு இல்லை இடம்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: O you image in the pupil (of my eye)! depart; there is no room for (my) fair-browed beloved.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: An extreme close-up of a lover's eye.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Inside the pupil ('கருமணியில்'), the tiny, reflected image of the lover's own self is visible ('பாவாய்'). The lover is speaking to this reflection.
Layered_Composition.Background: The lover is commanding his own reflection: 'You must leave!' ('நீ போதாய்'). He is trying to banish his own self-image from his eye to make room for the image of his beloved, who has a beautiful forehead ('திரு நுதல்'). Her image is shown waiting to enter his eye, but there is no room.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A playful and possessive declaration of love: the lover commands his own reflection to depart from the pupil of his eye, because there is no room for both himself and the image of his beloved.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The pupil of the eye as a physical space with limited room is the central conceit. The act of banishing oneself to make room for the other is a powerful symbol of total devotion and the desire to be completely filled by the beloved.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A clear, focused light on the eye. The reflection of the self is normal. The image of the beloved waiting to enter is a brilliant, radiant vision.

Technical_Cues.Camera: An impossible, macro shot that takes the viewer inside the pupil of the eye to witness this tiny, symbolic drama.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, hyper-realistic, with a focus on the reflections within the eye's surface.
